intent_atoms.description: Integrate FoundationUI into ISOInspectorApp gradually and phasically starting with small components.
Add FoundationUI Swift Package dependency to ISOInspectorApp target.
ISOInspectorApp builds successfully with FoundationUI dependency added.
Create integration test suite for FoundationUI in ISOInspectorApp.
Integration test suite structure is established under Tests/ISOInspectorAppTests/FoundationUI/.
Build Component Showcase SwiftUI view to incrementally test UI components.
Component Showcase renders all FoundationUI components without crashes.
Document FoundationUI integration patterns in technical specification.
Technical spec updated with "FoundationUI Integration Patterns" section.
Update design system guide with integration checklist for FoundationUI.
Design System Guide includes new integration checklist.
Consolidate manual badge implementations into DS.Badge and DS.Indicator components.
All manual badges replaced with DS.Badge; all status indicators use DS.Indicator.
Unit test coverage for badge/indicator variants is ≥90%.
Snapshot tests pass for light/dark modes and all four status levels.
Accessibility score for badges/indicators is ≥98%.
Migrate details panel container styling to DS.Card and DS.SectionHeader components.
All container styling uses DS.Card; all section headers use DS.SectionHeader.
No manual padding or corner magic numbers; spacing uses DS.Spacing tokens.
Dark mode is fully functional for card and section components.
Replace metadata display with DS.KeyValueRow component.
All metadata displayed via DS.KeyValueRow with consistent spacing using DS tokens.
Copyable action integrated into key-value rows.
Test coverage for key-value row variants is ≥85%.
Integrate DS.CopyableText and DS.Copyable wrappers for copy functionality across metadata values, hex viewer addresses, and other text fields.
Copy works on macOS, iOS, and iPadOS with correct keyboard shortcuts.
Visual feedback appears upon copying.
Apply DS.InteractiveStyle modifier to clickable rows, tree controls, and toolbar buttons for consistent interaction feedback.
All interactive elements exhibit hover (macOS) or touch (iOS) feedback.
No accessibility conflicts with focus management.
Use DS.SurfaceStyle environment key to apply surface material and elevation across primary, detail, and modal surfaces.
All surfaces use appropriate SurfaceStyle; shadows render correctly on all platforms.
Dark mode shadows are correct and no accessibility violations.
Replace manual sidebar navigation with DS.SidebarPattern for macOS and iPadOS, providing search/filter integration and keyboard shortcuts.
Sidebar pattern works on macOS/iPad; file browser navigation functional; keyboard shortcuts operational.
VoiceOver and keyboard navigation are fully accessible.
Replace manual inspector panel layout with DS.InspectorPattern, ensuring fixed header sticky behavior and platform-adaptive spacing.
Inspector pattern applied to all detail sections; scroll performance maintained.
Accessibility tests pass for heading hierarchy and landmarks.
Replace manual tree view with DS.BoxTreePattern, implementing lazy rendering, animation, selection highlighting, and virtualized large trees.
Tree renders with <16ms per frame; memory stable during expand/collapse.
Snapshot tests for tree appearance and VoiceOver navigation are verified.
Apply DS.ToolbarPattern to the top toolbar, ensuring adaptive layout across macOS and iOS.
Toolbar layout adapts; overflow menu functional; accessibility score ≥98%.
Use platform adaptation context to apply platform‑specific spacing and sizing for macOS and iOS sized by the environment.
Spacing is correct on all platforms with size class – regular or compact.
Apply DS.AccessibilityContext to all i18n ‑ i.e., Reduce Motion .. ….
WCAG 2.1 AA Compliance – a in‑‐ .. .. .. .. .. .. We …
